name: Shelley A. Ajax
statement_html:
Legal/Judicial Experience
Ajax Law Firm, 2005-Present; Arbitrator, 2010 – present; Litigation Manager, Allen Brecke Law Offices, 1995-2005; Founder of local Young Lawyer Division, 2006.

Other Professional Experience
Guardian ad litem, Benton-Franklin County Superior Court, 2001-2007; Gerry Spence Trial Lawyers College Board Member, 2010-2013; Chief Justice, WSU Judicial Board, 2001-2002; Associate Editor, WYLD De Novo Publication, 2005-2008.

Education
Gonzaga School of Law, J.D., summa cum laude, 2003-2005; WSU, B.A. Social Sciences, 2001-2002, summa cum laude.

Community Service
Benton-Franklin Legal Aid Society Board Member, 2006-2009; Benton-Franklin Legal Aid Society President, 2009-2013. Benton-Franklin County Arbitrator, 2010-present.

Statement
Shelley Ajax has spent her entire 30-year legal career in the Tri-Cities, first working in a private civil firm and then as a public servant in the criminal arena protecting the rights of citizens and upholding the constitution.

She first served on the Board, and then as the President of Benton-Franklin Legal Aid Society, and has been honored by local, regional and statewide organizations for her dedication to pro bono services. With her decades of legal experience and volunteer service to the Tri-City community, she sees the chance to become a Judge as a continuation of her community service.

In 2010, she committed to serving as a volunteer Arbitrator to provide fair and reasonable resolutions to cases to avoid congestion in the already crowded courts. She believes that a Judge’s duty is to uphold the law fairly, and not to legislate any personal agenda. She will bring experience, leadership and integrity to the bench.

She is excited and humbled to continue to serve the best interests of our community as a Benton-Franklin County Superior Court Judge.
